txt: (looking up) Ross, when’s this comet thing start?
Well, technically it seven
(groaning) Oh no! Oh no! (They all start to get up a leave.)

Okay! Okay! Fine, I’ll stop! No teaching, okay? We’ll just watch
the pretty light streaking across the sky. (Comets don’t streak across the sky,
meteors do.) Okay? Who’s official name is Bapstein-King.
Okay! Okay! (They start to leave again.)

(looking up) There it is! Oh, look at that! Isn’t Mother Nature
amazing?
(looking up with her) That’s a plane!

Well, all right. 1700 bags of peanuts flying that high, that’s
pretty amazing too.
Hey, I wonder if you can see my apartment from up here.
No. No, you can’t.
What?
Oh I don’t-I don’t know.

Man, look at all those stars! (Yeah, you can see what? Five of them from
the city?) Infinite space. It really, really makes you wonder, doesn’t it?

(looking through his binoculars at a nearby building) Y’know what
else makes you wonder?
Huh?

Check out the rack on this chick! (Turns around to point it out to Ross
and finds that Ross is glaring at him. So he quickly puts his binoculars to his eyes and
starts looking for the comet.)

Okay, we’ve been out here for two hours and we haven’t seen
any stupid comets. Can we go now? I mean, Chandler’s getting chilly. (She walks over
to where Chandler is bundled up in a big coat and shivering.)
(with a quivering voice) No, I’m not!
Then why are you wearing Monica’s jacket?

Because it’s flattering! (Shivers harder) Come on Monica! Come on
Monica! (He goes inside.)
Yeah actually, I think we’re gonna take off too. We rented a movie.
Oh! I won’t say, ‘no’ to a movie!
Uh Pheebs, we just actually kinda wanted to be alone.
Shh! Get me out of here.
Oh. (They leave, leaving just Joey and Ross.)
(whispering) Ross!
What?
Come here, check this out!
What? Is it the comet? (Runs over to where Joey’s standing.)

No! No-no. Look, there’s a bug stuck in tar right here. (Bends down
to get a closer look.)

Joey come—I can’t believe—I bring you here to see the
Bapstein-King comet, one of nature’s most spectacular phenomenon, and all you care
about are bugs stuck in tar and-and some woman!
(standing up) Y’know, there’s
Show me where?
Right-right up here. (Starts looking at them through a piece of pipe.)

(noticing the pipe and looking at the door) Joey where’s the pipe
that was holding the door open?

(annoyed) I don’t know! (Goes back to looking through the pipe.)
(Pause) Yeah, I do.
Joey!

What?! All right—Hey! Don’t look at me! You’re the one who
wanted to come up and look for some stupid

It’s called the Bapstein-King comet, okay? (Joey starts to groan.)
Hey! Hey! Bapstein was a very well respected astronomer!

(covering his ears and yelling) Oh no! No! No! (He starts banging on the
door.)
(whispering) Monica!
She’s sleeping.
I know, just quick-quick question, quick question. Which one was

Sorry, I just…can’t sleep. Ooh! (Turns on the light and
Monica groans.) Where is that book that you are reading with the two women who were
ice-skating and wearing, wearing those hats with the flowers on it? Because every time I
look at that cover I’m like…(Fake snores.)

It is in the living room where there is also a light! And no one will
kick you in the shin.

What?! (Monica kicks him in the shin.) Ow! (He gets out of bed and
heads into the living room.)

(crossing her fingers and closing her eyes) Please don’t be a space
ship. Please don’t be a space ship. (She turns on the light and looks around and
finds that it’s the smoke detector that’s beeping.) Oh thank God! (She moves a
chair over and starts to investigate how to make the beeping turn off, in frustration she
yanks the thing off of the wall. She sets it down and heads for bed, just as she gets
there it beeps again. She opens the cover and removes the battery, but it still beeps.)
How could you be beeping?! I just disconnected you! I took out your battery! How can…
Beep!
Don’t interrupt me!!
Rachel!! Monica!!
Come on!
I can’t believe this!!

All right well, y’know…I guess we know what we have to do to get
down.

(standing at the edge of the roof) Yeah, I guess we don’t have a
choice. (Screaming to the street) Help us! Please help us! We’re stuck up on the roof
and we can’t get down!!!

Ross. I was thinking we could just go down the fire escape. (Points it
out.)

(To Joey) I know, I wasn’t finished. (Joey motions him to finish.)
(Yelling at the street) But don’t worry! We’re gonna go down the fire escape!!

Shhhhhhhhh!!! (Monica enters) I’m sorry, I thought maybe I’d
make some warm milk and it would help me sleep.

With a wok? (Chandler’s holding a wok.) I thought you were going to
read my boring book to put you asleep.
It got interesting! Damn you Oprah!
Here, let me make the milk, I’m up anyway.

Hey, y’know what we can do? Y’know, now that we are up? We
can just like talk to each other all night long, y’know like we did when we were
first going out. It’d be fun!
Okay that does sound like fun.
Okay, so how bummed were you when the second sister died huh?
The second sister dies?!
(Pause) No. No, I-I was, I was talking about the book I was reading.
The second sister dies in
That’s correct.
You wanna go in the bedroom? It’s a little more comfortable.
Sure.

Okay. (They start to head for the bedroom) Oh wait! Umm, did you send
those contracts to Milan?

If this is your idea of sexy talk? (Shakes his head that it’s not
working.)

No seriously, y’know the contracts I gave you, did you overnight
them?
What contracts?

Okay please tell me that this is just one of your jokes that you do that
I don’t get.
Like what?

Y’know, like the thing when you put the phone in your pants? (He
starts laughing.) Tag! I’m serious! This isn’t funny! Those contracts absolutely
had to go out today!
Rach, I’m sorry, but you didn’t give me any contracts!
Yes I did! And I put a little
I’m telling you, you never gave them to me.

Y’know what Tag, if we went down to the office you would see those
contracts sitting on your desk.
No, I would see you looking embarrassed because they are

Or maybe you would see me looking embarrassed because you are talking on
the phone with your crotch!
You wanna go down to the office right now?
No! Come on its late, we’re not gonna go down to the office.

Okay I understand. (Sits down.) I wouldn’t want to be proved wrong
either.

Okay get your coat! (They get their coats and start to leave. Rachel
suddenly stops and sticks the hand up the back of her shirt.) Oh! When did you unhook
this? (Her bra.) Nice work!
All right, it won’t go down any further. It’s stuck.

Ugh. Well, we’re just gonna have to jump. (Joey looks at him.) Yeah.
Now, we’re gonna have to make sure to land to the right of that patch of ice, okay?
Not hit the dumpster on the other side and uh, and try to avoid that-that weird brownish
red stuff in the middle. So, when
Oh whoa-whoa wait a minute! I have to do it?!

Yeah! Oh yeah, you’ll be fine! It-it’ll be uh, just like bungy
jumping. Y’know? But instead of bouncing back up you-you won’t.
What if I smack my head on the concrete?
Well, I’m gonna lie to you Joey, it’s a possibility.

(looks at the ground and at Ross) I don’t know Ross! I-I tell you
what, let’s flip to see who does it, okay? You-you call it in the air, all right?

Oh, all right. (Joey flips the coin.) Tails! (The coin bounces off of the
landing above them and falls to the ground.) Can you-can you see what it is?
No.
Okay. Well, you be careful.

What? No! No Ross! No-no! Stop! I’m not jumping! Okay, look I have an
audition tomorrow and I can’t go if I break my leg.

Well I’m jumping! I have a son! Okay? He won’t have a father
if-if I die!
Well all right so, it looks like we’re even!

Okay. So, this wire is connected to this wire which plugs into here.
(She points at each as she says it.) Okay so, to get the beeping to stop all I have to
do… (She picks up a shoe and proceeds to pummel the smoke detector. She then gets up
and heads to bed, stops, quickly turns around, and is satisfied that the beeping has
stopped.) Well done, Pheebs. (She resumes her trek to bed, but is stopped at the entrance
to the hallway by the now steady and extremely loud tone emanating from the smoke
detector.) (Yelling.)

Okay, here’s your milk. What do you want to talk about? (She sees
that Chandler has fallen asleep and slams the door loudly to wake him up.)
(startled) What? What? What?

Ohh! Ohhhh! Were you sleeping sweetie? I’m sorry. Here. (Hands the
mug of milk to him.)

Okay! Feel free to look, but I’m telling you those contracts are not
on this desk.
Oh
It’s my sister.
Okay, very cute braces. Anyway y’know what, the

So when do you imagine you gave them to me? In the morning or in the
afternoon?

In the afternoon. Mr. Zelner came into my office after lunch. He put
them on my desk, and then I put a
It’s not here.

Puzzler. A bit of a puzzle. Why don’t you um, check the copy room,
maybe you left the contracts in there?
How could I have left them in the copy room?

I don’t know Tag! How can your genitals make phone calls? Okay?
It’s not a perfect world! Just go please.
Fine.

Thank you. (He leaves and she proceeds to plant the folder in his bottom
drawer. She then picks up the phone and holds it to her breasts.) Hello? (Hangs up the
phone.) I still don’t get it.
Are you still awake?
Yeah! You?

You do know that was me who just said that right? (He doesn’t
respond and she turns on the light, waking him.) Hey. As long as we’re both up…

(intrigued) Yeah? (Monica nods yes.) I hope you’re not thinking
about cleaning the living room.

Man, I’m starving! What the hell was I thinking at dinner?! "Do
you want soup or salad?" Both! Always order both!

(looking in the window behind them) Y’know, y’know I’m
lookin’ and I don’t think anyone’s home here. I say we just break the
window, crawl through, and-and y’know explain later.
Yeah? Really? No one’s home?

I don’t think so. Hello? (Knocks on the glass, which angers the big,
large, angry dog behind the glass and causes them to jump to the other side of the
landing.) When you get in there… (Joey nods his disapproval.)

Okay, this is where you and I part ways. (She drops the blanket into the
chute.) Noisy bitch!
What?! What are you doing?!
Do you know what just happened?
Yeah. We-we had sex and then we fell asleep.
No. We were in the middle of sex…and

Nooo! No, that’s not true. No, best time ever! Yeah, you rocked me
world! (She turns out the light to go back to sleep.)
(turning the light back on) Monica?
What?!

I was giving you some of my best moves, and you missed it. So please
wake up so
Okay. Okay, I’m ready. Come on big fella!
Okay.
Give me the good stuff.

Yeah! (Monica falls asleep) No! No! No! Don’t fall asleep! Okay,
I am going to make you some coffee. (Monica doesn’t move as he gets out of bed and as
he’s heading for the door.) And I probably won’t spill coffee grounds all over
the kitchen floor.
Okay, I’m up! I’m up!

Hi! I got you some coffee. To, uh… (She looks for a place to set it
on his messy desk and he clears a spot for her to set it down.) …fair enough. So! Do
you got anything for me?
Still no luck.
Oh my God! Did you check your entire desk! Did you check
Do you want me to check again?

Well yeah, I wish that you would. (He opens the top drawer.) Well, no
it’s not in there! (Closes it.) How about that drawer? (She points to the bottom one
and he opens it. She doesn’t see the folder she planted and bends over to check.)

Well, it’s not out here. Is there any chance it could be in your
office?

(thinks) Y’know, I don’t-I don’t know. Let me, let me
check. (As she heads for her office, she stops glances over her should at Tag, looks into
her office, and finds the folder on her desk.)
(smirking) Any luck?
Can I see you in my office for a minute?

(entering) Yeah? (She holds up the folder) You found them!! (Rachel is not
amused, because she’s still going to try to blame him for her mistake like every
‘good’ boss.) Y’know what? I’m not even going to gloat. I’m just
really relived this whole thing is over.
You put these on my desk!
I did not!
Oh really? So you’re saying they just
How did you know they were in my bottom drawer?

(pause as she realizes her lame attempt to shift the blame has failed) I
am so hot for you right now.
Oh my God! How did you get back here?!
(yelling through the door) Phoebe Buffay?!

(scared) Fire alarm? (She opens the door to reveal a fireman holding the
blanket with the smoke detector.) Oh! Hi, officer—fireman, can-can I help you?
We found your fire alarm in the trash chute.
That’s not mine.
Yes it is.
How do you know?

The next time you want to dump a fire alarm in a trash chute,
don’t wrap it in a blanket that says, "Property of Phoebe Buffay not
Monica."

Okay do you—Okay, do you have a search warrant? Because the last
time I checked this was still America!
Please reattach this, it’s against the law to disconnect them.

Fine! (She takes the blanket.) But please God; tell me how to stop them
from going off!
There’s a reset button under the plastic cover.

There’s a reset button?! Ugh, thank you! Thank you! (He exits and
she goes to shut it off.) There’s a reset button! My God! Why didn’t I see that!
(She takes off the plastic cover and looks for the button.) Reset button, reset button,
where is there a reset button? (Finds it.) Oh here it is! (Picks it up off of the floor.)
Oh! (She presses it hard, but of course it would help if the button was still attached to
the detector. In frustration she presses it so hard it causes pain in her thumb.) Ohh,
God!
Okay, do-do you have a good grip?
Yeah!
Okay, I’m going to start climb down you now.
All right! Just hurry up!

Okay. Now-now-now should I climb down your front so we’re face to
face or-or should I climb down your back so we’re-we’re butt to face.
I think face to face.
I would say that.
Face to face, yeah!
Okay, here I go.
All right.
(grunting) Oh my… How much do you weigh Ross?!

I prefer not to answer that right now, I’m still carrying a little
holiday weight.

Y’know, when we talked about face to face, I don’t think we
thought it all the way through.
So what do you want me to do?
Well, just shimmy down me and drop!
Hi.
Hi.
(looking down) M-maybe I should hang and you can climb down me.
(angrily) Yeah? Maybe we should talk about that for a little while!
It’s still looks pretty far!
It’s not that far! Just drop!
Do not

Ross, you should know that my pants are startin’ to come down and
I’m not wearing any underwear!

Oww!! My ankle! I really hurt my ankle! I think I twisted it when
I—Ooh, a quarter!
That really was some of your best work.

Hm-hmm, I told you! (Looks at the clock) I can’t believe that
I’ve only got two hours before I call in sick for work.
I have to be up in seven minutes.

Well, you’re not gonna believe this, but if you have seven
minutes…
Really?!
Do you wanna?
Okay! You get the vacuum cleaner and I’ll get the furniture polish!
